title: Implement Display Trait
description:
Practice implementing the Display trait for custom formatting.

## Requirements

1. Implement `Display` for `Temperature` struct
   - Format as "X.X C" or "X.X F" based on the unit field
   - Round to 1 decimal place

2. Implement `Display` for `Color` enum
   - RGB variant: "rgb(R, G, B)"
   - Hex variant: "#RRGGBB" (uppercase hex)

## Examples

- `Temperature { value: 23.5, unit: Unit::Celsius }` displays as "23.5 C"
- `Color::RGB(255, 128, 0)` displays as "rgb(255, 128, 0)"
- `Color::Hex(0xFF8800)` displays as "#FF8800"

testCases.assertion: format!("{}", Temperature { value: 23.5, unit: Unit::Celsius }) == "23.5 C"
format!("{}", Temperature { value: 98.6, unit: Unit::Fahrenheit }) == "98.6 F"
format!("{}", Temperature { value: 23.567, unit: Unit::Celsius }) == "23.6 C"

hints: Use write!(f, ...) to write to the formatter
For Temperature, match on self.unit to get the suffix letter
Use {:.1} format specifier for one decimal place
For Hex color, use {:06X} to get uppercase hex with leading zeros
Match on the Color enum variants to extract values
